about_the_game:
Pursue love and glory with unruly royals, seductive Fae, and rogue assassins in this epic romance set in a kingdom on the brink of war.

Their Majesties' Pleasure is a 200,000-word interactive novel by Leia Talon, where your choices control the story. It’s entirely text-based, without graphics or sound effects, and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination.

Unleash your inner rebel as you transform from humble guard to royal accomplice. Protect a headstrong princess and fun-loving prince on exploits into a city that comes alive at night, and adventure into a forest full of magic, demigods, and Fae. Ensnared in intrigue, your choices mean the difference between tentative peace or war on two fronts. You might become an emissary for the Crown and earn your knighthood, or decide your loyalties lie elsewhere and turn spy.

As the kingdom flirts with doom, love becomes your rock. Will you win the heart of a thrill-seeking princess enthralled with the Fae? A pleasure-loving prince entrenched with enemies of the Crown? A Rogue King who runs the city’s finest night house and leads an army of assassins? A demigoddess who holds court in the Darkwood? Or a Fae prince whose warrior instincts are as honed as his skills as a lover?

  • Play as male, female, or non-binary; gay, straight, bi, asexual, or poly.
  • Become an ambassador to the Crown, side with the army of assassins defending the
    city, or stake your loyalty with the Fae.
  • Romance a provocative prince, a feisty princess, a rogue king, a demigoddess, or an
    immortal warrior. Intimate moments and polyamorous options abound.
  • Use your wits to scheme, your blades to slay, and your heart to guide your desires.
  • Choose honor and duty, party like there’s no tomorrow, or incite mutiny to save the
    Realm.

    Which wilful royal will win your warrior heart?

content_descriptors.notes: This game, though entirely text-based, contains erotic content and sexual situations in which players can make choices to engage in sexual acts and situations as part of a text-based narrative.
